html:
6.22.24  2:43 am   how do airplanes fly

      i think the pilot presses a button but i'm not sure which one. pilots have 1000 buttons in front of them, it's one of those. the other buttons do nothing of course

6.22.24  1:35 am   hello. i think i have the most fun when i start new songs, like the first day of writing a song. after that it starts to feel like a chore. am i doomed to only making starts of songs that never end up being worked on more or heard by anyone?

      it's a different job. for a different mood. working on songs is a fun thing to do, but it's an entirely different kind of fun than song-starting. it's understandably never that you will ever be in the mood to work/finish a song at the same time as starting it. what i'd suggest is, keep starting songs and save them up. then it will become more rewarding to embark on the separate journey of learning how to work on them. you'll also need a 3rd skill of choosing which one to work on

6.22.24  12:30 am   are you still in the mailbox?

      i have always been, and still am, outside the mailbox

6.22.24  12:14 am   what if ratatouille was a mouse

      i'll admit that would make things easier

6.21.24  5:54 pm   so we know you don't like traditional albums. what are your thoughts on concept albums, with songs that fade into each other and/or have a story to tell and such.

6.21.24  4:17 pm   should i climb a tree tonight

      i'm not sure

6.21.24  3:16 pm   You always say that chords tend to be baked into melodies, but how do I actually learn how to intuitively harmonize the melody using this knowledge?

It feels like I have to compromise on the chords whenever I start with the melody first, or compromise on the melody by starting with the chords first.

      i think it's gonna be the same way you learned about speaking (english), which words go along with other words, how to say stuff, .... how to spell, how to talk, .......... Actually, how did you learn how to do all that? probably just from years of exposure to the language. music goes the same way. expose yourself to music, in the actual world, in all all your favorite ways it is used. soon all the harmonic relationships will seem as obvious to you as finding the words for the sentences you speak

      start telling stories

6.20.24  10:29 pm   How do I continue songs that have a really hood start in which I actively want to complete but have a hard time continuing them without it devolving it to some dragging-on ABABABAB song structure or some other boring continuation? It's been absolutely annoying me lately because it's been a while since I've actually completed a song as a result.

      the best way to get out of this, goes something like this: hypothetically, imagine a way of songwriting that you NEVER, NEVER, NEVER would do

6.20.24  9:51 pm   how do you get over the fear of publishing stuff that you made?

      the fear of not publishing it gets worse

6.20.24  9:48 pm   is the ground plane the sequel to at the airport terminal

      no

6.20.24  9:09 pm   what is your perspective on musicians who were made from an extremely early age to train classically before or never even being asked if they wanted to? any angle that comes to mind 

      it's the polar opposite of my own experience. mostly when i meet someone who's been in that situation, they usually tell me they no longer do anything musical and they've quit long ago. or, another interesting outcome is they can read (or memorize) and play music exactly note-for-note verbatim the way someone else arranged it, without any ability to create their own music. like someone who can read scripts but can't actually talk to anyone

6.20.24  8:24 pm   If you could go back in time, Where would you go?

      down the street

6.20.24  8:18 pm   how to decide what to do if there are multiple things i want to do

      explain what they all are, and then explain the advantages and disadvantages of doing each one first

6.20.24  7:13 am   What question did I ask again?

      this one

6.20.24  5:14 am   Dear Bill Wurtz,
I noticed a hypocrisy. At some point someone asked "  Are you more inclined to answer a sincere question over a kinda goobed one or is it just a matter of the ones that call out to you?" and you answered "all of these questions are ungoobed. the goobed ones don't even get through" meanwhile some people ask questions like: "Is mush a goup?" "Hello why are mangos yellow" "why is it that that that is is that that is not is not is not that it it is", I believe 'goobed' would be a good descriptor word for these questions. This is not a personal offence to you, I enjoy your music and think you're probably a decent person. I also understand that this is your question board where you are fully within your right to answer whatever questions you want. despite this, I still going to point it out. May you have a good day.

Best regards,
An Anonymous Internet user

      the thing you may have overlooked is, in that case, my answer was goobed

6.19.24  10:18 pm   i waste a lot of time not making the thing while i'm making something. is there a remedy for this?

      vlog it. you'll see how the whole process looks from an outside perspective, and one way or another you'll see a more reasonable point of view

6.19.24  10:07 pm   i theorize that people are like albums. every few years, some key events happen, and like songs, make it into the personal album for that time frame. since you have mentioned that you wouldn't want to make an album, do you have an opposing theory?

      that's everything good about albums, but ignoring the fact that albums hardly ever any actual material besides the list of songs. no video, no puzzles, no conversations,
